laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent ECGs were unchanged from the preoperative tracings.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Marked ST depression in the inferolateral leads, ventricular and supraventricular tachyarrhythmias (ventricular rate of 178 beats/min), frequent multifocal premature ventricular contractions progressing to runs of ventricular tachycardia.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: All symptoms resolved and the ECG abnormalities completely disappeared within 1 hour after administration of nitroglycerin.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Exercised 7 min on Bruce protocol, maximum heart rate of 150 beats/min, no chest pain or ECG changes.
Demonstrated no evidence of ischemia or prior infarction.
Normal left ventricular systolic function, mild tricuspid and mitral insufficiency.
Rare premature ventricular contractions and atrial contractions with three nonsustained runs of asymptomatic supraventricular tachycardia, no evidence of significant ischemia.
